item.title: 14 Open Source DevOps Tools We Use in Production - Logz.io
item.description:
14 Open Source DevOps Tools We Use in Production - Logz.io

We at Logz.io are an open source analytics company that develops Big Data technology around log data, and some of the challenges that we face are the same challenges that all next-generation, DevOps-driven organizations face. How do we manage our source code? How do we do continuous deployment?

item.title: DevOps is good for your operations team
item.description:
DevOps is good for your operations team

If you're managing IT operations, you've heard that DevOps has the power to help IT move faster, scale up quickly with less pain, and boost efficiency. Now you may be thinking about how DevOps might help you and your team cope with the increasing pace and quantity of work coming your way.

item.title: What's up with Open Source Technology in 2016
item.description:
What's up with Open Source Technology in 2016

I've recently had the opportunity to give talks at two open source conferences. At both events my topic was the tools and strategies the OpenStack® project's Infrastructure team uses to collaborate online. The first conference was the 14th Annual Southern California Linux Expo (SCALE 14x) in Pasaden...

item.title: Is DevOps just a 're-branding' of ops?
item.description:
Is DevOps just a 're-branding' of ops?

Interest in DevOps is intense, but have the roles and responsibilities, even within organisations that have adopted it, really changed? "Plus ça change, plus c'est la même chose," goes the old saying - the more things change, the more they stay the same.

item.title: Using DevOps, app agility to rethink how you engage with customers
item.description:
Using DevOps, app agility to rethink how you engage with customers

In my last article, I talked about how cloud computing IT organizations to restructure the application life cycle to leverage agile development, quality assurance, artifacts, and operations. Cloud computing has reset expectations with regard to how fast applications should be delivered, DevOps is key, and only by re-examining every part of how IT does its business can your organization move at the speed of cloud.

item.title: Career makeover: From ops to devops
item.description:
Career makeover: From ops to devops

Long ago, in a IT operations model far, far away, businesses built their data centers. Rows and rows of server racks humming away in closets tangled with cables -- that was IT's lifeblood. It was a time when virtualization meant that thing a couple of gung-ho admins toyed with on an old HP DL360 server destined for the garbage bin.

item.title: Etsy CTO Q&A: We Need Software Engineers, Not Developers - The New Stack
item.description:
Etsy CTO Q&A: We Need Software Engineers, Not Developers - The New Stack

When it comes to the practice of DevOps, few companies have been on the cutting edge as long as Etsy, which once famously asserted that its new engineer hires would commit code to production after the first day of work. Don't be fooled by the crafty look-and-feel of Etsy.

item.title: Docker Networking Design Philosophy
item.description:
Docker Networking Design Philosophy

From the experimental networking in Docker 1.7 to the initial release in Docker 1.9, the reception from the community has been fantastic! First of all we want to thank you for all the discussions, evaluations, PRs and filed issues. As the networking capabilities evolving with every release, we wanted to spend some time explaining the guiding principles behind the design.

item.title: SecOps: Put security in DevOps first, not as an add-on
item.description:
SecOps: Put security in DevOps first, not as an add-on

Most people don't think about security when it comes to DevOps, but the process involves many vulnerabilities. Data at rest and in flight is left unencrypted in many cases. Moreover, role-based security is often tossed out the window to allow for faster production. In this article, I'll explore the critical issues with DevOps security.

item.title: The 13 developer skills you need to master now
item.description:
The 13 developer skills you need to master now

Heavy weighs the crown of the developer king. Yes, as software eats the world, demand for skilled developers remains high. But software's pervasiveness -- from the server to the cloud to the coming onslaught of wearable and IoT devices -- means far greater responsibilities for software engineers and the need to constantly expand your skills.
